Loss of Productivity: Businesses and organizations would suffer from a loss of productivity as their employees would not be able to access important information or communicate with clients.
Disruption of Transportation: GPS systems in cars and other transportation devices would malfunction, leading to confusion and potential accidents.
Medical Emergencies: People with medical devices such as pacemakers or insulin pumps would not be able to receive necessary updates or alerts, potentially leading to serious health issues.
Financial Losses: Companies and individuals would suffer financial losses due to the inability to complete transactions or access important financial information.
Disruption of Power Supplies: Electronic devices rely on electricity, so the sudden stop would cause a disruption in power supplies, leading to blackouts and other power-related issues.
